title: Is Botox Too Easy to Get?
text:
At Alchemy 43, an aesthetics bar in New York’s Flatiron neighborhood, treatments using Botox, Juvederm and Restylane are packaged with cutesy names like “Hello, Bright Eyes” and “Smooth Talker.” Patterned wallpaper and neon signage have clearly been conceived with selfie-taking in mind, and consultations are conducted (unless otherwise requested) more casually at a communal table. In the street-level location’s window, passersby will find the company’s credo: Because the best work goes unnoticed.

Founder Nicci Levy started...
description: Drop-in injectable bars are on the rise as familiarity and comfort with minimally invasive cosmetic procedures has grown. But do they downplay the risks?
